title.narrative: POLICIES, PROGRAMME AND COORDINATION

description.narrative: By 2022, the political and programmatic environment, including coordination, partnership and governance (national and local), is strengthened., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Disaster Risk Reduction, Early Childhood Development, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition (Covid), Environmental Sustainability, Evaluation, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Maternal And Newborn Health, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Sanitation, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid), Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Water, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,boys and girls aged 0-59 months, adolescents and women (especially those living in the most disadvantaged communities) have access to basic services, use packages of multisectoral high-impact, gender-sensitive interventions (health /HIV, nutrition, WASH) and adopt appropriate behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the political and programmatic environment, including coordination, partnership and governance (national and local), isstrengthened.

description.narrative: La revue à mi-parcours du PNDS 2015-2024 s’est traduit par l’élaboration du plan triennal 2022-2024 prenant en compte les principales actions prioritaires pour accélérer l’atteinte des résultats planifiés de même que les documents de stratégies sectoriels dans le contexte de la persistance de la pandémie de la COVID-19 et des épidémies récurrentes. La gouvernance du secteur a également été renforcée à travers l’appui à la fonctionnalité des plateformes de coordination multisectorielles dans les domaines de la santé, de la nutrition et du WASH. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/02/2022
